The real problem can’t be fixed by your method

Anyone?

item.source: Multiple interfaces at the same time

item.title: Multiple interfaces at the same time
item.dc:creator: @l0gin1 l0gin.
item.description:
@l0gin1 wrote:

I don’t think that is possible because whenever you try to load one it’ll close when you try to open another one

maybe you should just add the items to the player’s inventory rather then show the interface?

OR

you could do something like

public boolean starterAdded;

public void TutorialIsland(Client c) { if(starterAdded = true) { DialogueHandler.sendStartInfo(c, "To start the tutorial use your left mouse button to click on the", "RuneScape Guide in this room. He is indicated by a flashing", "yellow arrow above his head. If you can't see him, use your", "keyboard's arrow keys to rotate the view.", "Getting started")" } }

Then whereever your actionbuttons are you could make it so that when the close button of the interface is closed it’ll then send the dialogue

I don’t know how action buttons work in p.i but it could be something like

case CLOSEINTERFACEBUTTON: c.starterAdded = true; break;

I’m sure i might of done something wrong there but hopefully you get the idea of what im trying to get at

Read full topic
item.source: Multiple interfaces at the same time

item.title: Multiple interfaces at the same time
item.dc:creator: @matiasmunk matiasmunk
item.description:
@matiasmunk wrote:

Hi there. I’ve began on a new project.
I’m creating a RS Remake, just to mess around with to become better with Java.
But I’ve stumbled onto a problem.
Whenever I’m trying to create two or more interfaces at the same time.
Only one of them appears, and the second one completely vanishes.
Example:

public void addStarter() { c.getPA().showInterface(3559); c.canChangeAppearance = true; }
My addStarter method to open up the Character Creation interface, the first time a player logs in.

public void TutorialIsland(Client c) { DialogueHandler.sendStartInfo(c, "To start the tutorial use your left mouse button to click on the", "RuneScape Guide in this room. He is indicated by a flashing", "yellow arrow above his head. If you can't see him, use your", "keyboard's arrow keys to rotate the view.", "Getting started"); }
My TutorialIsland method to send a chat interface, containing the text above.

Now, my problem is, that it only shows the Character Creation and not this.

Btw, it’s a Project Insanity base. I can’t remember which one, because I downloaded it probably a year ago, as a cleaned out PI

Read full topic
item.source: Multiple interfaces at the same time
